pullRequest.title: Add a method to check if a name or a signature is Qtype
pullRequest.bodyText:
Add a method to check if a name or a signature is Qtype to be shared between the VM and JIT.
Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com

nodes.bodyText: do the full NULL != utfWrapper check here
also if braces are on the same line if (NULL != utfWrapper) { if its a one condition if statement
do you still have any use for isClassRefQtype? it was added for the JIT. If it is not longer needed you can remove it from the table
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -376,6 +376,7 @@ J9InternalVMFunctions J9InternalFunctions = {
 #endif /* J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER */
 	createJoinableThreadWithCategory,
 	valueTypeCapableAcmp,
+	isNameOrSignatureQtype,
 	isClassRefQtype,

beforeCommit.message:
Add a method to check if a name or a signature is Qtype

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>

afterCommit.message:
Add a method to check if a name or a signature is Qtype

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: and here, it should have been added the first time

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2333,6 +2333,17 @@ classPrepareWithWithUnflattenedFlattenables(J9VMThread *currentThread, J9Class *
 BOOLEAN
 valueTypeCapableAcmp(J9VMThread *currentThread, j9object_t lhs, j9object_t rhs);
 
+/**
+ * Determines if a name or a signature pointed by a J9UTF8 pointer is a Qtype.
+ *
+ * @param[in] utfWrapper J9UTF8 pointer that points to the name or the signature
+ *
+ * @return TRUE if the name or the signature pointed by the J9UTF8 pointer is a Qtype, false otherwise
